answerText: fMRI [or functional magnetic resonance imaging][10] At Harvard, Joshua Greene does fMRI studies of people considering this ethical problem to isolate brain areas related to moral reasoning. It considers a choice to kill one person or let five die as the title object approaches.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | Tiebrakers | 5 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A useful mnemonic notes that the signal from this technique is BOLD, or blood oxygen level dependent, since it effectively shows areas where higher concentrations of oxygenated blood are. For 10 points each: [10] Name this imaging technique whose "functional" variant can be used to roughly show brain activity in real time without any danger of radiation.
